newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian stocks end lower,further downside seen.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian stocks end lower,further downside seen.

text.p: Slovenian shares tumbled 4.13 percent on Wednesday as the exodus on Tuesday of many foreign investors from the country's fledgling equity market weighed heavily on sentiment, traders said.
"If foreigners return, liquidity on the market will increase and shares could begin rising by the end of the week," said Toni Apollonio, analyst at "A" bank.
* The SBI index fell 50.54 points to 1,174.2.
* Turnover rose to 576.1 million tolars from 304.4 million.
* Overall 14 shares fell and four rose, while another six were untraded.
